page.title: 07Transport Around Sharnbrook
page.content: Most families in Sharnbrook own one or two cars, so do not rely heavily on {public transport.}Two local employers {(Odell leather, and Unilever)}provide transport for their workers. There is an hourly weekday bus service to Bedford, with an extra bus at 08.15 for people travelling to work. It is impossible to travel by bus to Rushden and arrive in time for work. For longer journeys it is necessary to go to Bedford and catch a bus or train. The main St. Pancras to the North line passes through the village, but the {station,}opened in 1857, was{closed in {May 1960.}A number of people indicated that they would like the station re_opened. Several people travel daily to London, catching the train in Bedford. They would welcome the convenience of a local station.
